pr_title: SQL: update ODBC docs, cover Cloud ID, latest params

timeline.message:
Refresh snapshots with latest look

Add new snapshots with the connection editor to reflect the latest UI.

Document the effect of the late added params

Add details about the Cloud ID setting, as well as those on the Misc
tab.

fix indentation issues

- remove star char added on line folding.

timeline.author: astefan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -172,7 +181,71 @@ will be considered by default. Choose _All Files (\*.*)_ from the drop down, if
 image:images/sql/odbc/dsn_editor_security_cert.png[]
 
 [float]
-===== 2.4 Logging parameters
+===== 2.4 Connection parameters
+The connection configuration can further be tweaked by the following parameters, but these should only need to be changed in rare cases.
+
+* Request timeout (s)
++
+The maximum number of seconds a request to the server can take. The value 0 disables disables the timeout.

replies.bodyText: Maybe: The maximum duration in seconds for a request to the server.
replies.author: matriv

replies.bodyText: Fixed the doubling and adopted the reformulation.
replies.author: bpintea

timeline.bodyText: Sounds a bit weird "these should only need to be changed", but I have no better alternative.
timeline.author: astefan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -172,7 +181,71 @@ will be considered by default. Choose _All Files (\*.*)_ from the drop down, if
 image:images/sql/odbc/dsn_editor_security_cert.png[]

-===== 2.4 Logging parameters
+===== 2.4 Connection parameters
+The connection configuration can further be tweaked by the following parameters, but these should only need to be changed in rare cases.

replies.bodyText: maybe just: .. be tweaked by the following parameters, which is not usually required except from some rare cases., or even without the except from some rare cases.
replies.author: matriv

replies.bodyText: Thanks. I've removed everything past the comma, since I doubt that these type of vague formulations make a significant difference in users' behaviour.
replies.author: bpintea

timeline.bodyText: Maybe it's more clear like ".... server should send back to the driver for one page"?
timeline.author: astefan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -172,7 +181,71 @@ will be considered by default. Choose _All Files (\*.*)_ from the drop down, if
 image:images/sql/odbc/dsn_editor_security_cert.png[]
 
 [float]
-===== 2.4 Logging parameters
+===== 2.4 Connection parameters
+The connection configuration can further be tweaked by the following parameters, but these should only need to be changed in rare cases.
+
+* Request timeout (s)
++
+The maximum number of seconds a request to the server can take. The value 0 disables disables the timeout.
+This corresponds to the `Timeout` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Max page size (rows)
++
+The maximum number of rows that Elasticsearch SQL server should send the driver for one page.

-===== 2.4 Logging parameters
+===== 2.4 Connection parameters
+The connection configuration can further be tweaked by the following parameters, but these should only need to be changed in rare cases.
+
+* Request timeout (s)
++
+The maximum number of seconds a request to the server can take. The value 0 disables disables the timeout.
+This corresponds to the `Timeout` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.

+* Max page size (rows)

replies.bodyText: I think both to and with are valid. I'm not a native speaker but to sounds better to me.
replies.author: matriv

timeline.author: astefan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -172,7 +181,71 @@ will be considered by default. Choose _All Files (\*.*)_ from the drop down, if
 image:images/sql/odbc/dsn_editor_security_cert.png[]
 
 [float]
-===== 2.4 Logging parameters
+===== 2.4 Connection parameters
+The connection configuration can further be tweaked by the following parameters, but these should only need to be changed in rare cases.
+
+* Request timeout (s)
++
+The maximum number of seconds a request to the server can take. The value 0 disables disables the timeout.
+This corresponds to the `Timeout` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Max page size (rows)
++
+The maximum number of rows that Elasticsearch SQL server should send the driver for one page.
+This corresponds to the `MaxFetchSize` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Max page length (MB)
++
+The maximum number of megabytes that the driver will accept for one page.
+This corresponds to the `MaxBodySizeMB` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.

timeline.author: astefan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -285,11 +358,37 @@ The maximum time (in seconds) a request to the server can take. This can be
 overridden by a larger statement-level timeout setting. The value 0 means no
 timeout.
 
+
 `Follow` (default: `yes`)::
 A boolean value (`yes`|`no` / `true`|`false` / `0`|`1`) controlling if the
 driver will follow HTTP redirects.
 
 
+`Packing` (default: `CBOR`)::
+This value controls which data format to encode the REST content in. Possible
+values are:
+
+* `CBOR`: use the Concise Binary Object Representation format. This is the
+preferred encoding, given its more compact format.
+
+* `JSON`: use the JavaScript Object Notation format. This format is more
+verbose, but easier to read, handful in debugging cases.

timeline.bodyText:
I don't thing the ? is necessary in the header.
Same for the rest of the headers.
timeline.author: matriv
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -172,7 +181,71 @@ will be considered by default. Choose _All Files (\*.*)_ from the drop down, if
 image:images/sql/odbc/dsn_editor_security_cert.png[]
 
 [float]
-===== 2.4 Logging parameters
+===== 2.4 Connection parameters
+The connection configuration can further be tweaked by the following parameters, but these should only need to be changed in rare cases.
+
+* Request timeout (s)
++
+The maximum number of seconds a request to the server can take. The value 0 disables disables the timeout.
+This corresponds to the `Timeout` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Max page size (rows)
++
+The maximum number of rows that Elasticsearch SQL server should send the driver for one page.
+This corresponds to the `MaxFetchSize` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Max page length (MB)
++
+The maximum number of megabytes that the driver will accept for one page.
+This corresponds to the `MaxBodySizeMB` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Floats format
++
+How should the floating point numbers be printed, when these are converted to string by the driver.
+This corresponds to the `ScientificFloats` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Data encoding
++
+How should the data between the server and the driver be encoded as.
+This corresponds to the `Packing` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Data compression
++
+Should the data between the server and the driver be compressed?
+This corresponds to the `Compression` setting in <<odbc-cfg-dsnparams>>.
++
+* Follow HTTP redirects?

replies.bodyText:
The logged option mirror the config options (and their working) in the GUI itself and those options with a question mark are a tick box.
It is debatable if the ? makes the settings clearer there too, but I'd keep these two in sync for now.
replies.author: bpintea
